intro: Tragacantha otiporensis, commonly known as the Otiporensis tragacanth, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant produces a gum resin, similar to tragacanth, which has been used in traditional medicine. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
